data.meaning_mnemonic: You pick up your <radical>knife</radical> and <radical>broom</radical> because you're getting ready to <kanji>return home</kanji>. There'll be a lot of work to do when you return home — cooking, cleaning, fixing stuff — so your knife and broom are sure to come in handy.
data.meaning_hint: Your knife is one of those Swiss Army knives, so it's got a bunch of tools you'll need when you return home. Your broom is just a broom, but… maybe if you pretend to ride it like a witch, it'll make the trip home more fun?
data.reading_mnemonic: For you to <kanji>return home</kanji>, your family has to ask the world to <reading>返</reading>す (かえ) you to them. You belong at home with your family — the outside world is just borrowing you, and eventually it needs to 返す you and let you return home.
data.reading_hint: Imagine your family asking all your coworkers and friends to 返す you so you can return home. It's heartwarming, but also kind of embarrassing at the same time.
